image.altText: Albanese and Wong enter the prime minister's courtyard, walking up to two lecterns.

props.synopsis: As a stream of momentum towards recognising a Palestinian state grew stronger, one moment made a splash that led many nations, including Australia, to say now was the time to act.

title.children: Moment the PM gained confidence Australia could recognise a Palestinian state

image.altText: A young Palestinian man in a press vest and helmet speaks into a microphone featuring the Al Jazeera logo.

props.synopsis: Palestinian journalist Anas al-Sharif predicted his own death, believing he'd been targeted by an IDF smear campaign as a precursor for his assassination. On Monday his premonition came true, when he was killed by Israeli forces alongside four of his Al Jazeera colleagues.

title.children: Journalists in Gaza are writing their own obituaries, after Israel brands them 'terrorists'

image.altText: two women, one in a purple head dress and the other in a red dress speak to a camera

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Authority's foreign minister says Australia's decision will "bring others to recognise, hopefully, and it safeguards the two-state solution".

title.children: West Bank locals say Australia recognising Palestine is 'amazing'

image.altText: A woman in a suit looks down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old woman is speaking out years after she was allegedly sexually harassed by her boss at a Mexican restaurant, after the Federal Court this month ordered he pay her a record $305,000.

title.children: Record sexual harassment payout after boss allegedly shows porn, sex toys to worker

image.altText: A woman with a short brown bob and rounded glasses wearing a grey blazer sits in a room with a small microphone in front of her.

props.synopsis: Having dashed hopes for some much-needed respite from cost-of-living pressures three weeks ago, it would be a brave RBA that again denies households a rate cut today.

title.children: Rate cuts are coming, but are they too late?

image.altText: A large circular formation of bleached coral underwater.

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the damage to coral reefs including the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo has eclipsed any previous bleaching events.

title.children: From 'hope spot' to 'skeletons': Ningaloo's 'catastrophic' event

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister says Benjamin Netanyahu is "in denial" about the impact the conflict in Gaza is having on innocent civilians. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese says Netanyahu 'in denial' about conflict's impact on civilians

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Netanyahu 'in denial' about conflict's impact on innocent civilians: PM
Wong 'deeply concerned' after Israeli strike killed five journalists
Macron backs in Albanese on Palestine

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: Young Australian hospitalised after ChatGPT use

image.altText: Two large boats collide near a third vessel which they are chasing on open ocean

props.synopsis: Video shows the moment a Chinese vessel hits the front of the other while on the open sea.

title.children: Fate of Chinese crew unknown after dramatic collision in South China Sea

image.altText: Reserve Bank sign overlaid with inflation chart

props.synopsis: Financial markets are pricing in a 99 per cent chance of an 0.25 percentage point cut when the central bank board delivers its decision this afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Reserve Bank interest rate cut considered a near-certainty

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Reserve Bank to hand down interest rate decision 2:30pm AEST
Rate cuts are coming, but are they too late?
Millions spent on ski resorts to combat competition and climate change

image.altText: Mima McKim-Hill

props.synopsis: Mima McKim-Hill was murdered in Central Queensland in 1967. Over half a century later, her suspected killer has never faced justice.

title.children: Mima McKim-Hill died in 1967. Her suspected killer never faced justice

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at the White House while holding a paper showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his administration is seizing control of the Washington DC police department and deploying the National Guard to crack down on local crime and "clear" the city of homelessness.

title.children: Trump activates National Guard in Washington, takes over local police

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to Vladimir Putin standing next to him.

props.synopsis: This week marks the first time Russian President Vladimir Putin has set foot on American soil in almost a decade — but the place he's meeting Donald Trump once belonged to Russia.

title.children: Here's why Trump and Putin picked Alaska for their first meeting in years

image.altText: Geoff Pearson stands in a paddock with cattle behind him

props.synopsis: A cattle farmer says he's been unable to stock one of his paddocks for three years because hunters keep cutting fences which let his livestock out.

title.children: 'Endless' trespassers cost farmers thousands and endanger life

image.altText: A woman and man shake hands standing in front of flags smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The Nakamal Agreement will cover infrastructure, climate change resilience and economic development, but details on travel and visa arrangements between the two countries remain under wraps.

title.children: Australia close to signing 'ambitious' pact with Vanuatu worth $500m

image.altText: A crowd of protesters in India

props.synopsis: Critics and opposition leaders say the exercise will impact minorities the most, including Muslims, and disallow them from voting.

title.children: India's opposition parties protest controversial electoral roll revision

image.altText: Underwater shot of researchers holding dugong.

props.synopsis: The world's largest health study of dugongs in Moreton Bay provides critical clues for helping conserve the enigmatic marine mammal, especially in other locations where numbers are falling.

title.children: It takes 30 minutes to check the health of a dugong. This is what's involved

image.altText: A photo of two people, leaning on a farm fence and looking at the camera, at their rural home

props.synopsis: Richard and Kimberly Byers went from running their own business and living comfortably to being unable to afford groceries, a story charity Foodbank says is becoming all too common.

title.children: From double incomes to 'drowning in debt', households turn to food charity

image.altText: Ben Stokes and Pat Cummins hold a trophy together

props.synopsis: Two decades after playing one of the best Test series ever, Australia and England's equally flawed sides mean the 2005 epic could well be toppled this summer.

title.children: Australia and England's conspicuous flaws set the table for epic Ashes

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Kr in a black suit and tie sitting at a table while speaking and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: Under the watch of Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr a vaccine-preventable disease has continued to spread across the US.

title.children: US on the brink of major public health failure

image.altText: Eleven people, seven men and four women in suits and blazers, stand together in front of microphones in a garden.

props.synopsis: From logging backflips and racing cuts to a surprise treasurer nomination, the major Tasmanian parties have made their first moves ahead of next week's pivotal no-confidence vote.

title.children: First compromises signal the race to form government in Tasmania is on

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large multi-storey hospital with a glass and concrete split level facade.

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents obtained by the ABC reveal staff raised concerns that no move date had been given for the new Footscray Hospital opening months before the state government announced delays.

title.children: Staff had concerns about Footscray Hospital opening before delays announced

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police swarm a house in Melbourne's south-east after the bodies of the man and woman were discovered.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: Brahman cattle in field.

props.synopsis: A gutted north-west Queensland grazier warns others to vaccinate against blackleg, after nearly 40 of his cattle die of the deadly soil-borne disease.

title.children: North Queensland grazier warns of blackleg disease after cattle die

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing black sunglasses and a black top holds a red AFL football on a film set.

props.synopsis: The international hip-hop artist has been announced as the pre-game entertainment for the 2025 AFL grand final.

title.children: Rapper Snoop Dogg to entertain MCG crowd at the AFL grand final

image.altText: A mid shot of Dockers captain Nat Fyfe handballing a football wearing his white Fremantle jersey.

props.synopsis: As Nat Fyfe announces his retirement from AFL footy, Tom Wildie examines where the Fremantle Dockers champion sits among the all-time greats the state has produced.

title.children: Where Nat Fyfe ranks among WA's AFL greats

image.altText: Two smiling women with a football.

props.synopsis: It was a speech made more than 100 years ago, but the words within are inspiring AFLW players to block out the noise of criticism.

title.children: How a quote derived from a US president's speech is inspiring AFLW players

image.altText: A group of people, photographed from behind, seated in chairs and looking toward a TV.

props.synopsis: A rehabilitation centre in northern NSW says it is leaving beds empty despite lengthy waiting lists as it does not always have enough staff to operate at capacity.

title.children: Staff shortages mean six-month waiting lists for empty rehab beds

image.altText: Grace Harris holds her bat and a fist in the air in celebration

props.synopsis: Grace Harris is fast emerging as the dominant player in England's Hundred competition, again leading table-toppers London Spirit to victory.

title.children: Harris continues to dominate Hundred as Aussies top run charts

image.altText: A palm tree growing dates in a dry orchard

props.synopsis: Dates are a niche industry in Australia, but the growers' association hopes the promise of a lucrative export market and a unique geographical position could make it an appealing one.

title.children: Date industry looking for growers keen to capture 'seller's market'

image.altText: A close up of wood burning in a fireplace.

props.synopsis: Robin Phillips said he was sick for days after inhaling wood heater smoke and is calling on authorities to better enforce rules around the heating device's use.

title.children: How to use a wood heater properly, and why it matters

image.altText: An Iraqi man stands under an electricity transmission tower looking up at it

props.synopsis: Power goes out across the country amid a heatwave that Iraqi meteorological services expect to last more than a week, with temperatures climbing as high as 50 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Iraq experiences nationwide power outage amid 'record' heat

image.altText: Building exterior with logo City of Parramatta

props.synopsis: Parramatta councillors have voted against seeking more information over reports the corruption watchdog raided its offices last month.

title.children: Bid for details over reported Parramatta Council ICAC raid knocked back

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: More Victorians died of drug overdoses in 2024 compared to any other year in the past decade, a new Coroners Court of Victoria report shows, with a 16 per cent increase in deaths since 2015.

title.children: Victoria records highest number of fatal overdoses in a decade

image.altText: Meth rocks on a table.

props.synopsis: WA Police in the region prosecute 366 drug offences between April and June 2025, the most for a quarter since 2017.

title.children: Drug arrests spike in Kimberley as police crack down on trade
